commit message: build: Changed version string to debug
OSX build fixes
add OSX build script and instructions

front: Removed obsolete menu items.

Got rid of the 'Migrate slot saves' item, it's been six months since
Trev's version was removed from the market.  At this point, better just
to handle such issues on the forum.

Also removed a few remnants of code left over after we moved the
'Controller info' item to the mapping screen menu.

front: Changed 'OUYA mode' to 'Big-screen mode'.

Like Steam's 'Big Picture' mode.

Big-screen mode is useful for anyone running the app on a television or
monitor, not just OUYA users.  Also makes the code a little more clear,
avoiding confusion with OUYAInterface.IS_OUYA_HARDWARE, which tests
exclusively for the presence of the OUYA system.

Also consolidated the ActionBar check into a UserPrefs field for better
readability.

front: Added missing list preference check.

front: Tweaked scaling and documentation for raphnet adapters.

See Issues #89 and #99.

front: Improve readability of a few calculations.
Initialize all members of ExtTxtrInfo before copying to gTxtrDumpInfos

front: Fix scaling for Mayflash N64/USB adapter.

Closes Issue #188 and forum post
http://www.paulscode.com/forum/index.php?topic=1076

Also cleaned up some of the raphnet stuff a little more, trying to
consolidate code.  I'll probably make a sensitivity setting soon to
allow users to compensate for 'wear' in the original N64 optical en-
coders.

front: Remove unnecessary analog clamp.

The AbstractController subclasses are already handling the magnitude
checks.  Plus this applied a square constraint (rather than circle or
octagon) which isn't what we want anyhow.

front: Added analog sensitivity preference for peripheral controllers.

In the input mapping screen, next to the deadzone preference.

Use SDL1.2 keysym in the config when using SDL2

It is easier for a user to keep the old SDL1.2 values for the keys in the
config instead of converting them by hand. This is extreme important when the
default (automatic) config is used.

add COREDIR=/usr/local/lib/ to build_bundle_bin.sh, so that the ui-console front-end can find the core library when installed in a distro which doesnt have /usr/local/lib/ in the /etc/ld.so.conf file
update text files for upcoming 2.0 release

Avoid crash caused by missing initial SDL startup

SDL needs to overwrite the main function to initialize the inner state on some
operating systems. Not doing it this way will cause random crashes and
undefined behaviour.

Systems which need a special main function are for example Apple MacOS,
Android, iPhone or Win32. SDL will handle it automatically and keep systems
without such requirement with an untouched main function.

Revert: Implement SI register DMA busy bit

The implementation of the SI regiser DMA busy bit caused regressions in games
like Mischief Makers (no gamepad input is detected by the game). The only known
benefit seems to be the reduced message spam about duplicated interrupts.

The message spam caused by some ROMS can be tolerated until the cause of the
regression is better understood.

This reverts 734b67b8ff647cc355b5f6b781799c42e75e81ea ('Implement SI register
DMA busy bit')

git: Fix line endings (?).

glide: Add frameskip feature.

A hack and slash transplant operation.  Just pulled the FrameSkipper
class from the gles2n64 plugin, and wired it into gles2glide64.  Prefs
are passed through the gles2glide config file for now.  Eventually they
should be migrated to the official mupen config file.  (Although up-
stream hasn't migrated everything yet either, so we could just wait
until they're finished.)

I made the defaults for glide 'No more than 5 frames', whereas gles2n64
defaults to 'No more than 2 frames'.  Open to debate...

If this implementation sticks, then we should probably move the Frame-
Skipper and ticks files into the ae-bridge, since they're carbon copies
between gles2n64 and gles2glide64.

front: Display asset extraction errors to user.

To facilitate user support without having to deal with logcat.

To test this code, do the following:
- comment out line 139 in MainActivity.java
- replace line 200 in AppData.java with a nonsense string

front/assets: Split large assets into smaller files.

Assets larger than 1MB cannot be extracted in Android 2.2 and below.
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/2860157/load-files-bigger-than-1m-from-assets-folder

The cheats data files have been split into smaller pieces, and Asset-
Extractor has been updated to reassemble the pieces after extraction.
